sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: این موضوع به این معناست که این ویروس در حال گسترش درون جوامع است و برخی افراد نمی‌دانند که از کجا یا چگونه آلوده شده‌اند. به افرادی که برای مبتلایان احتمالی، مراقبت‌های بهداشتی ارائه می‌دهند، توصیه می‌شود اقدامات احتیاطی استاندارد، اقدامات احتیاطی مربوط به تماس را رعایت کنند و از محافظ چشم استفاده کنند. ردگیری تماس‌ها یکی از شیوه‌های مهم برای مقامات بهداشتی است تا بتوانند منبع آلودگی را تشخیص دهند و از انتقال بیشتر آن جلوگیری کنند.
en-mt: This means that the virus is spreading within communities and some people don't know where or how they got infected. Those providing health care to potentially infected individuals are advised to follow standard precautions, contact precautions, and use eye protection. Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to identify the source of contamination and prevent further transmission.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: استفاده از اطلاعات موقعیت مکانی تلفن همراه توسط دولت‌ها برای این هدف، موجب نگرانی‌هایی در زمینه حریم خصوصی شده است و سازمان عفو بین‌الملل و بیش از 100 سازمان دیگر، بیانیه‌ای برای محدود کردن این نوع از نظارت صادر کرده‌اند.
en-mt: The use of cellphone location data by governments for this purpose has raised privacy concerns, and Amnesty International and more than 100 other organizations have issued a statement calling for restrictions on this type of surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: برنامه‌های مختلفی برای تلفن همراه ایجاد یا پیشنهاد شده تا به صورت داوطلبانه مورد استفاده قرار گیرد و تا 7 آوریل 2020، بیش از ده‌ها گروه کارشناس در حال تلاش برای راه‌حل هایی هستند که نقض کننده حریم خصوصی نباشد مانند استفاده از بلوتوث برای ثبت میزان نزدیک شدن کاربر به سایر تلفن‌های همراه.
en-mt: Various mobile phone apps have been created or proposed to be used voluntarily, and as of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups are working on non-privacy-infringing solutions, such as using Bluetooth to record proximity. User to other mobile phones.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: سپس، کاربران در صورتی که در تماس نزدیک با یک فرد مبتلا به کووید-19 باشند، پیامی دریافت می‌کنند.برخی تصورات غلط در مورد نحوه پیشگیری از این بیماری در حال پخش هستند؛ مثلاً شستشوی بینی یا غرغره با دهانشویه، راه‌های مؤثری نیستند.
en-mt: Then, users will receive a message if they have been in close contact with a person with Covid-19. Some misconceptions about how to prevent the disease are circulating; For example, washing the nose or gargling with mouthwash are not effective ways.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: اگر چه بسیاری از سازمان‌ها در تلاش برای ساخت واکسن هستند اما هنوز هیچ واکسنی برای کووید-19 وجود ندارد.
en-mt: Although many organizations are trying to develop a vaccine, there is still no vaccine for Covid-19.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: جهت جلوگیری از شیوع بیماری، شستشوی دست‌ها توصیه می‌شود.
en-mt: To prevent the spread of the disease, hand washing is recommended.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC توصیه می‌کند که افراد به طور مکرر دست‌های خود را با آب و صابون حداقل به مدت بیست ثانیه بشویند، به ویژه پس از توالت یا مواقعی که دست‌ها به وضوح کثیف هستند؛ قبل از غذا خوردن؛ پس از خالی کردن بینی، سرفه یا عطسه.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after using the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; After blowing the nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: این کار به این دلیل است که این ویروس در خارج از بدن انسان با صابون خانگی، که حباب محافظ آن را از بین می‌برد، کشته می‌شود.
en-mt: This is because the virus is killed outside the human body with household soap, which destroys its protective bubble.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: CDC همچنین توصیه می‌کند در مواقعی که آب و صابون به راحتی در دسترس نباشد، از ضدعفونی‌کننده‌های مبتنی بر الکل با حداقل حجم 60% الکل استفاده شود.
en-mt: The CDC also recommends using alcohol-based hand sanitizers with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: سازمان بهداشت جهانی به مردم توصیه می‌کند از لمس چشم‌ها، بینی و دهان خود با دست‌های نشسته خودداری کنند.
en-mt: The World Health Organization advises people to avoid touching their eyes, nose and mouth with bare hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: رفع آلودگی از سطوح به روش‌های مختلف امکانپذیر است (یک دقیقه قرار گرفتن در معرض مواد ضد عفونی کننده برای سطح استیل ضد زنگ)، از جمله 71-62% اتانول، 100-50% ایزوپروپانول، 0.1% سدیم هیپوکلریت، 0.5% هیدروژن پراکسید و 7.5-0.2% بتادین.
en-mt: Decontamination of surfaces is possible by various methods (one minute exposure to disinfectants for stainless steel surfaces), including 62-71% ethanol, 50-100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide. and 0.2-7.5% betadine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: روش‌های دیگر از جمله کلرید بنزالکونیوم و کلرهگزیدین گلوکونات اثربخشی کمتری دارند.
en-mt: Other methods, including benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC توصیه می‌کند در صورتی که یک مورد مشکوک یا تأیید شده از کووید در ساختمانی مانند دفتر کار یا مرکز مراقبت روزانه وجود داشته باشد، تمام بخش‌ها از قبیل دفاتر، سرویس‌های بهداشتی، مناطق مشترک، دستگاه‌های الکترونیکی مشترک مانند تبلت‌، صفحات لمسی، صفحه‌کلید، کنترل از راه دور و دستگاه‌های خودپرداز که توسط افراد بیمار استفاده شده است، باید ضد عفونی شوند.
en-mt: CDC recommends that if there is a suspected or confirmed case of Covid in a building such as an office or day care center, all areas such as offices, restrooms, common areas, shared electronic devices such as tablets, touch screens, keyboards, Remote controls and ATMs that have been used by sick people should be disinfected.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: سازمان‌های بهداشتی توصیه کرده‌اند که افراد در هنگام سرفه یا عطسه، دهان و بینی خود را با آرنج خود یا دستمال بپوشانند و دستمال را بلافاصله دور بیندازند.
en-mt: Health organizations have recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with their elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing and discard the tissue immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: برای افرادی که احتمال آلوده بودن آنها وجود دارد، ماسک‌های جراحی توصیه می‌شود زیرا پوشیدن ماسک می‌تواند حجم و فاصله پرتاب ذراتی را که در هنگام صحبت کردن، عطسه یا سرفه پراکنده می‌شوند، کاهش دهد.
en-mt: For people who are likely to be infected, surgical masks are recommended because wearing a mask can reduce the volume and distance of particles released when talking, sneezing, or coughing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: سازمان جهانی بهداشت، دستورالعمل‌هایی را در مورد زمان و نحوه استفاده از ماسک صادر کرده است.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has issued guidelines on when and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: بر اساس گفته‌های Stephen Griffin، ویروس‌شناس دانشگاه لیدز، "پوشیدن ماسک می‌تواند رغبت افراد به لمس صورت‌شان را که در صورت رعایت نکردن بهداشت مناسب دست، یکی از منابع مهم ابتلا است، کاهش دهد."همچنین استفاده از ماسک، برای کسانی که از افراد مشکوک به ابتلا به بیماری مراقبت می‌کنند نیز توصیه می‌شود.
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the desire of people to touch their face, which is one of the important sources of infection if they do not observe proper hand hygiene." It is also recommended to take care of those who are suspected of having the disease.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: سازمان بهداشت جهانی پوشیدن ماسک توسط افراد سالم را تنها در صورتی توصیه می‌کند که در معرض خطر زیادی قرار دارند، مثلاً کسانی که از افراد مبتلا به کووید-19 مراقبت می‌کنند، با این حال، آنها نیز تأیید می‌کنند که پوشیدن ماسک کمک می‌کند که افراد از دست زدن به صورت‌شان خودداری کنند.
en-mt: The World Health Organization recommends that healthy people only wear masks if they are at high risk, such as those caring for people with Covid-19, however, they also confirm that wearing masks helps people Avoid touching their face.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: چندین کشور شروع به تشویق افراد جامعه به پوشیدن ماسک صورت کرده‌اند.
en-mt: Several countries have started encouraging people to wear face masks.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: در ایالات متحده، CDC توصیه می‌کند که ماسک‌های غیر پزشکی که از پارچه ساخته شده، استفاده شود. چین به طور مشخص، استفاده از ماسک‌های پزشکی یکبار مصرف را توسط افراد سالم جامعه توصیه کرده است، به خصوص هنگامی که با سایر افراد ارتباط نزدیک (1 متر (3 فوت) یا کمتر) دارند.
en-mt: In the United States, the CDC recommends that non-medical masks made of cloth be used. China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy people in the community, especially when in close contact (1 meter (3 feet) or less) with others.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: هنگ‌کنگ توصیه کرده است که هنگام استفاده از حمل‌و‌نقل عمومی یا توقف در مکان‌های شلوغ، از ماسک جراحی استفاده شود.
en-mt: Hong Kong has recommended that a surgical mask be worn when using public transport or stopping in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: مقامات بهداشتی تایلند مردم را ترغیب می‌کنند تا با استفاده از پارچه، در خانه ماسک درست کنند و آنها را به صورت روزانه بشویند.
en-mt: Thai health officials are encouraging people to make masks at home using cloth and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: جمهوری چک و اسلواکی، بیرون رفتن و حضور افراد در اجتماع را بدون پوشیدن ماسک یا پوشاندن دهان و بینی ممنوع کرده‌اند.
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia have banned people from going out and being in public without wearing a mask or covering their mouth and nose.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: در 16 مارس، ویتنام از همه مردم درخواست کرد تا هنگام رفتن به مکان‌های عمومی، به منظور حفاظت از خود و دیگران، ماسک بزنند.
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam asked all people to wear masks when going out in public to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: دولت استرالیا، داشتن ماسک را برای کسانی که به فروشگاه‌های مواد غذایی مراجعه می‌کنند، اجباری کرده است.
en-mt: The Australian government has made it mandatory for those who visit grocery stores to wear masks.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: اسرائیل از تمام ساکنان خود خواسته است هنگام حضور در اجتماع ماسک بزنند.
en-mt: Israel has asked all its residents to wear masks when attending public gatherings.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: تایوان که از اواسط مارس، در حال تولید ده میلیون ماسک در هر روز بوده است، مسافران قطارها و اتوبوس‌های بین شهری را از 1 آوریل ملزم به پوشیدن ماسک کرده است.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks a day since mid-March, has required passengers on intercity trains and buses to wear masks since April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: پاناما پوشیدن ماسک در هنگام بیرون رفتن را اجباری کرده است و به کسانی که نمی‌توانند ماسک بخرند، توصیه کرده است که خودشان ماسک خانگی درست کنند.
en-mt: Panama has made it mandatory to wear a mask when going out, and has advised those who cannot afford one to make their own at home.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: ماسک‌ها همچنین به طور گسترده در ژاپن، کره جنوبی، مالزی و سنگاپور مورد استفاده قرار می‌گیرد.
en-mt: Masks are also widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: فاصله‌گذاری اجتماعی (که با عنوان فاصله‌گذاری فیزیکی هم شناخته می‌شود) شامل اقدامات کنترل آلودگی است که با هدف کند کردن شیوع بیماری با حداقل کردن ارتباط نزدیک بین افراد، انجام می‌شود.
en-mt: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) involves infection control measures aimed at slowing the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between people.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: این شیوه‌ها شامل قرنطینه؛ محدودیت سفر؛ تعطیلی مدارس و محل‌های کار، استادیوم‌ها، تئاترها و مراکز خرید می‌باشد.
en-mt: These methods include quarantine; travel restrictions; Schools and workplaces, stadiums, theaters and shopping centers are closed.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: افراد با ماندن در خانه، محدود کردن سفر، خودداری از حضور در مناطق شلوغ، سلام و احوالپرسی بدون تماس و فاصله گرفتن فیزیکی از دیگران می‌توانند این شیوه‌ها را اجرا کنند.
en-mt: People can implement these practices by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, greeting without contact, and physically distancing themselves from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: در حال حاضر، بسیاری از دولت‌ها در مناطقی که این بیماری شیوع دارد، فاصله‌گذاری اجتماعی را اجباری کرده یا آن را توصیه کرده‌اند.
en-mt: Currently, many governments have mandated or recommended social distancing in areas where the disease is prevalent.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: حداکثر تعداد توصیه شده تجمع افراد توسط نهادهای دولتی و سازمان‌های بهداشتی ایالات متحده، به سرعت از 250 نفر (در صورتی که هیچ‌گونه شیوع بیماری کووید-19 در منطقه وجود نداشته باشد) به 50 نفر و بعداً به 10 نفر کاهش یافت.
en-mt: The recommended maximum number of people gathering by US government agencies and health agencies was quickly reduced from 250 people (if there was no outbreak of Covid-19 in the area) to 50 people and later to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: در تاریخ 22 مارس 2020، آلمان تجمع بیش از دو نفر را ممنوع کرد. افراد سالمند و کسانی که دارای بیماری‌های زمینه‌ای از قبیل دیابت، بیماری قلبی، بیماری تنفسی، فشار خون و نقص سیستم ایمنی هستند با خطر بیشتری برای ابتلا و عوارض شدید مواجهند و CDC به این دسته از افراد توصیه کرده است که در مناطقی که این بیماری در جامعه شیوع پیدا کرده است، تا حد امکان در خانه بمانند. در اواخر مارس 2020، سازمان بهداشت جهانی و سایر نهادهای بهداشتی شروع به جایگزینی استفاده از واژه "فاصله‌گذاری اجتماعی" با "فاصله‌گذاری فیزیکی" کردند، تا به طور واضح نشان دهند که هدف از این کار، کاهش ارتباط فیزیکی و در عین حال حفظ روابط اجتماعی، چه به صورت مجازی و چه از راه دور است.
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, Germany banned gatherings of more than two people. Elderly people and those with underlying diseases such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, high blood pressure, and immune system deficiency are at a higher risk of contracting and severe complications, and the CDC has advised these groups of people to stay in areas where this disease is prevalent. It has spread in the community, stay at home as much as possible. In late March 2020, the World Health Organization and other health bodies began replacing the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to make it clear that the goal is to reduce physical contact while maintaining relationships. social, whether it is virtual or remote.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: استفاده از واژه "فاصله‌گذاری اجتماعی" به جای ترغیب افراد به حفظ ارتباطات با استفاده از شیوه‌های جایگزین، بر این مفهوم دلالت داشت که افراد باید وارد انزوای اجتماعی کامل شوند. برخی مسئولین دستورالعمل‌هایی را در زمینه بهداشت جنسی، جهت استفاده در طول این پاندمی صادر کردند.
en-mt: The use of the term "social distancing" implied that people should go into complete social isolation rather than encouraging people to maintain contact using alternative methods. Some officials have issued guidelines on sexual hygiene to be used during this pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: این دستورالعمل‌های شامل توصیه‌هایی در مورد این بود که تنها با فردی که با او زندگی می‌کنید، فردی که مبتلا به ویروس نیست و یا علایم ویروس را ندارد، رابطه جنسی داشته باشید.
en-mt: The guidelines included advice to only have sex with someone you live with, someone who doesn't have the virus or who doesn't have symptoms.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: برای افرادی که مبتلا به کووید-19 تشخیص داده شده‌اند و کسانی که مشکوک به آلوده شدن هستند، قرنظینه شخصی در خانه توصیه شده است.
en-mt: Self-quarantine at home is recommended for people who have been diagnosed with Covid-19 and those who are suspected of being infected.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: سازمان‌های بهداشتی، دستورالعمل‌های جزئی را برای قرنطینه شخصی صحیح مشخص کرده‌اند. بسیاری از دولت‌ها، قرنطینه شخصی را برای تمام افرادی که در نواحی متأثر از این ویروس زندگی می‌کنند، اجباری کرده یا آن را توصیه کرده‌اند.
en-mt: Health organizations have specified detailed guidelines for proper personal quarantine. Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for all people living in areas affected by the virus.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: شدیدترین دستورالعمل‌های قرنطینه شخصی برای کسانی صادر شده که در گروه‌های پر خطر قرار دارند.
en-mt: The strictest personal quarantine guidelines have been issued for those in high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: به کسانی که ممکن است با افراد مبتلا به کووید-19 در تماس بوده باشند و کسانی که اخیراً به کشور یا منطقه‌ای که این بیماری به طور گسترده شیوع پیدا کرده است، سفر کرده‌اند، توصیه شده است از زمان آخرین ارتباط، به مدت 14 روز قرنطینه شخصی را رعایت کنند.
en-mt: Those who may have been in contact with people with Covid-19 and those who have recently traveled to a country or region where the disease has been widely spread are advised to self-isolate for 14 days since last contact. Observe personal quarantine.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: استراتژی‌های کنترل شیوع یک بیماری عبارتند از مهار، سرکوب و کاهش.
en-mt: Strategies to control the spread of a disease include containment, suppression, and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: مهار در مراحل اولیه شیوع و با هدف ردگیری و جدا کردن افراد مبتلا و همچنین معرفی سایر اقدامات برای کنترل بیماری و واکسیناسیون برای توقف شیوع بیماری به بقیه جمعیت انجام می‌شود.
en-mt: Containment is done in the early stages of the outbreak with the aim of tracking and isolating infected people, as well as introducing other measures to control the disease and vaccination to stop the spread of the disease to the rest of the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: هنگامی که مهار گسترش بیماری، دیگر امکانپذیر نباشد، تلاش‌ها به سمت استراتژی کاهش منتقل می‌شود: اقداماتی انجام می‌شود تا میزان شیوع کمتر شود و تأثیرات آن بر سیستم بهداشتی و جامعه کاهش پیدا کند.
en-mt: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of a disease, efforts are shifted to a mitigation strategy: actions are taken to reduce the spread of the disease and reduce its impact on the health system and society.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: می‌توان ترکیبی از اقدامات مربوط به مهار و کاهش را به طور همزمان اجرا نمود.
en-mt: A combination of containment and mitigation measures can be implemented simultaneously.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: سرکوب به اقدامات شدیدتری به منظور معکوس کردن پاندمی با کاهش عدد سرایت پایه به کمتر از 1 نیاز دارد.بخش از مدیریت شیوع یک بیماری عفونی، تلاش برای کاهش پیک همه‌گیری است که با عنوان صاف کردن منحنی همه‌گیری شناخته می‌شود.
en-mt: Suppression requires more drastic measures to reverse the pandemic by reducing the base transmission number to less than 1. Part of managing the outbreak of an infectious disease is trying to reduce the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: این موضوع، خطر وارد شدن فشار بیش از حد به خدمات بهداشتی را کاهش می‌دهد و زمان بیشتری برای تولید و توسعه واکسن‌ها و درمان‌ها فراهم می‌کند.
en-mt: This would reduce the risk of overburdening health services and allow more time to develop vaccines and treatments.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: مداخلات غیر دارویی که می‌توانند به مدیریت شیوع این بیماری کمک کنند عبارتند از اقدامات پیشگیرانه شخصی از جمله رعایت بهداشت دست، پوشیدن ماسک، قرنطینه شخصی؛ اقدامات اجتماعی با هدف فاصله‌گذاری فیزیکی از جمله تعطیلی مدارس و لغو رویدادهایی که در آنها تجمع زیاد افراد وجود دارد؛ مشارکت اجتماعی برای ترغیب به پذیرش و رعایت این مداخلات؛ و همچنین اقدامات محیطی از قبیل تمیز کردن سطوح. هنگامی که شدت بالای شیوع بیماری در چین مشخص شد، اقدامات شدیدتری با هدف مهار آن انجام گرفت از جمله قرنطینه کردن کل شهرها و اجرای ممنوعیت‌های سختگیرانه در زمینه سفر.
en-mt: Non-pharmacological interventions that can help manage the spread of this disease include personal preventive measures such as hand hygiene, wearing masks, self-quarantine; Social measures aimed at physical distancing, including closing schools and canceling events in which there is a large gathering of people; Social participation to encourage the acceptance and compliance of these interventions; as well as environmental measures such as cleaning surfaces. When the high severity of the disease outbreak in China became clear, more drastic measures were taken to contain it, including the quarantine of entire cities and the implementation of strict travel bans.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: سایر کشورها نیز مجموعه‌ای از اقدامات را با هدف محدود کردن گسترش این ویروس اجرا کردند.
en-mt: Other countries also implemented a series of measures aimed at limiting the spread of this virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: کره‌جنوبی غربالگری گروهی و قرنطینه محلی را اجرا کرد و هشدارهایی را در زمینه جابجایی افراد مبتلا صادر کرد.
en-mt: South Korea implemented group screening and local quarantine and issued warnings on the movement of infected people.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: سنگاپور برای افراد مبتلایی که خود را قرنطینه کنند، حمایت مالی در نظر گرفت و جریمه‌های سنگینی را برای کسانی که این کار را انجام ندهند، وضع کرد.
en-mt: Singapore offered financial support for infected people to self-quarantine and imposed heavy fines for those who failed to do so.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: تایوان تولید ماسک را افزایش داد و برای احتکار لوازم پزشکی، مجازات وضع کرد. شبیه‌سازی‌های انجام شده برای بریتانیا و ایالات متحده نشان می‌دهد که استراتژی کاهش (کند کردن گسترش همه‌گیری و نه توقف آن) و سرکوب (معکوس کردن رشد همه‌گیری) با چالش‌های بزرگی مواجهند.
en-mt: Taiwan increased production of masks and imposed penalties for hoarding medical supplies. Simulations for the United Kingdom and the United States show that strategies for mitigation (slowing the spread of the epidemic rather than stopping it) and suppression (reversing the growth of the epidemic) face major challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: سیاست‌های بهینه کاهش می‌تواند پیک تقاضای بهداشتی را به 2/3 و میزان مرگ‌و‌میر را به نصف کاهش دهد، اما هنوز هم به کشته شدن صدها هزار نفر منجر می‌شود و فشار بیش از حدی را هم به سیستم بهداشتی وارد می‌کند.
en-mt: Optimal abatement policies could cut peak health demand by two-thirds and the death rate by half, but it would still kill hundreds of thousands of people and put too much strain on the health system.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: سرکوب می‌تواند استراتژی بهتری باشد اما تا زمانی که ویروس در جمعیت انسانی در گردش است (یا تا زمانی که واکسنی تهیه شود، اگر این اتفاق زودتر باشد)، باید حفظ شود، زیرا در صورت رها شدن اقدامات، میزان سرایت به سرعت به مقدار قبل باز می‌گردد.
en-mt: Suppression would be a better strategy, but it should be maintained as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine is available, if that happens sooner), because if measures are abandoned, the rate of transmission will quickly return to its previous level. It will return.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: مداخله طولانی مدت برای سرکوب این پاندمی، موجب ایجاد هزینه‌های اجتماعی و اقتصادی می‌شود.
en-mt: Long-term intervention to suppress this pandemic causes social and economic costs.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: هیچ داروی ضد ویروس تأیید شده‌ای برای کووید-19 وجود ندارد، البته تلاش‌هایی برای ساخت آن در حال انجام است، از جمله آزمایش داروهای موجود.
en-mt: There is no approved antiviral drug for Covid-19, although efforts are underway to develop one, including testing existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: استفاده از داروهای بدون نیاز به نسخه سرماخوردگی، نوشیدن مایعات و استراحت می‌تواند به کاهش علایم کمک کند.
en-mt: Using over-the-counter cold medicines, drinking fluids and resting can help reduce symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: بسته به میزان شدت، ممکن است به اکسیژن درمانی، تزریق وریدی مایعات و دستگاه‌های کمک تنفسی نیاز باشد.
en-mt: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, IV fluids, and ventilators may be needed.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: استفاده از استروئیدها می‌تواند شرایط را بدتر کند.
en-mt: Using steroids can make the condition worse.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: چندین مورد از ترکیباتی که قبلاً برای درمان سایر بیماری‌های ویروسی تأیید شده‌اند، در حال بررسی هستند تا در صورت مفید بودن برای درمان کووید-19 استفاده شوند.
en-mt: Several compounds already approved for the treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating Covid-19 if they prove useful.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: سازمان جهانی بهداشت همچنین "چند داروی سنتی و خانگی" را که می‌تواند به تسکین علایم SARS-CoV-19 کمک کنند، اعلام کرده است.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has also announced "several traditional and home remedies" that can help relieve the symptoms of SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: سازمان بهداشت جهانی، افزایش ظرفیت و تطبیق سیستم بهداشتی با نیازهای بیماران کووید-19 را یکی از اقدامات اساسی برای مقابله با شیوع این بیماری توصیف کرده است.
en-mt: The World Health Organization has described increasing the capacity and adapting the health system to the needs of Covid-19 patients as one of the basic measures to deal with the spread of this disease.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC و دفتر منطقه‌ای اروپای سازمان جهانی بهداشت، دستورالعمل‌هایی را برای بیمارستان‌ها و خدمات مراقبت‌های بهداشتی اولیه برای انتقال منابع به سطوح مختلف صادر کرده است، از جمله تمرکز خدمات آزمایشگاهی بر آزمایش کووید-19، لغو عمل‌های جراحی غیرضروری در صورت امکان، جدا کردن و ایزوله کردن بیماران مبتلا به کووید-19 و افزایش ظرفیت مراقبت‌های ویژه با آموزش دادن پرسنل و افزایش تعداد ونتیلاتورها و تخت‌های در دسترس.
en-mt: ECDC and the WHO Regional Office for Europe have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary health care services to shift resources to different levels, including focusing laboratory services on Covid-19 testing, canceling unnecessary surgeries where possible, isolating and Isolating patients with Covid-19 and increasing the capacity of special care by training personnel and increasing the number of ventilators and beds available.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: در مورد اینکه منشأ اولین مورد (به اصطلاح بیمار صفر) کجا بوده است، نظرات مختلفی وجود دارد.
en-mt: There are differing opinions as to where the first case (the so-called patient zero) originated.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: اولین مورد از کرونا ویروس جدید ممکن است به 1 دسامبر 2019 در ووهان، هوبی، چین برگردد.
en-mt: The first case of the novel coronavirus may date back to December 1, 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: طی مدت یک ماه، تعداد موارد مبتلا به کرونا ویروس در هوبی به تدریج افزایش یافت.
en-mt: Over the course of a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: اغلب این افراد با بازار عمده فروشی غذاهای دریایی هوانا که حیوانات زنده نیز می‌فروخت، مرتبط بودند و یکی از نظریات این است که منشأ این ویروس، یک نوع از این حیوانات بوده است؛ یعنی به عبارت دیگر این ویروس منشأ حیوانی دارد. گروهی از افراد مبتلا به ذات‌الریه با علت نامعلوم در 26 دسامبر مشاهده شدند و توسط دکتر Zhang Jixian در بیمارستان استانی هوبی مورد درمان قرار گرفتند که در 27 دسامبر، موضوع را به Wuhan Jianghan CDC اطلاع داد.
en-mt: Most of these people were associated with the wholesale market of seafood in Havana, which also sold live animals, and one of the theories is that the origin of this virus was a type of these animals; In other words, this virus is of animal origin. A group of people with pneumonia of unknown cause were seen on December 26 and treated by Dr. Zhang Jixian at Hubei Provincial Hospital, who reported the matter to the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: در تاریخ 30 دسامبر، گروهی از پزشکان در بیمارستان مرکزی ووهان، به همکاران خود در مورد یک "کرونا ویروس شبیه سارس" هشدار دادند.
en-mt: On December 30, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital warned their colleagues about a "SARS-like coronavirus".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: پلیس به هشت تن از این پزشکان از جمله Li Wenliang توصیه کرد تا از پخش شایعات نادرست خودداری کنند و پزشک دیگری به نام Ai Fen به دلیل ارائه این هشدار، توسط مافوق‌های خود تنبیه شد.
en-mt: Police advised eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, to stop spreading false rumors, and another doctor, Ai Fen, was disciplined by his superiors for issuing the warning.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: بعداً، کمیسیون بهداشت شهر ووهان در تاریخ 31 دسامبر یک اطلاعیه عمومی صادر کرد و موضوع را به سازمان جهانی بهداشت اطلاع داد.
en-mt: Later, the Wuhan City Health Commission issued a public notice on December 31 and reported the matter to the World Health Organization.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: موارد زیادی از ذات‌الریه با علت ناشناخته به مقامات بهداشتی ووهان گزارش شد و باعث شد تا در اوایل ژانویه، تحقیقاتی در این زمینه آغاز کنند. در اولین مراحل شیوع، تعداد موارد مبتلا، تقریباً هر هفت و نیم روز، دو برابر می‌شد.
en-mt: Multiple cases of pneumonia of unknown cause were reported to Wuhan health authorities, prompting them to launch an investigation in early January. In the early stages of the outbreak, the number of infected cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: در اوایل و اواسط ژانویه 2020، این ویروس به کمک مسافرت‌های مربوط به سال نوی چینی و با توجه به اینکه ووهان یکی از قطب‌های حمل‌و‌نقل و مراکز اصلی مبادله ریلی است، به سایر استان‌های چین منتقل شد.
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus was transmitted to other provinces in China with the help of Chinese New Year travel and considering that Wuhan is one of the main transportation hubs and rail exchange centers.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: در تاریخ 20 ژانویه 2020، چین حدود 140 مورد جدید، از جمله یک نفر در پکن و یک نفر در شنژن را طی یک روز گزارش داد.
en-mt: On January 20, 2020, China reported about 140 new cases, including one in Beijing and one in Shenzhen, in one day.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: داده‌های رسمی بعدی نشان می‌دهد که 6,174 نفر تا 20 ژانویه 2020، دارای علایم بوده‌اند.تا 26 مارس، ایالات متحده با بالاترین آمار موارد تأیید شده ابتلا در جهان، از چین و ایتالیا سبقت گرفت. تا 9 آوریل 2020، بیش از 1.31 میلیون مورد ابتلا در سراسر جهان گزارش شد؛ بیش از 97,000 نفر جان باختند و 364,000 نفر بهبود پیدا کردند.
en-mt: The latest official data shows that 6,174 people had symptoms as of January 20, 2020. As of March 26, the United States has surpassed China and Italy to have the highest number of confirmed cases in the world. As of April 9, 2020, more than 1.31 million cases have been reported worldwide; More than 97,000 people died and 364,000 people recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: حدود 200 کشور و قلمرو حکومتی، حداقل یک مورد ابتلا داشته‌اند.
en-mt: About 200 countries and territories have at least one infected case.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: به دلیل این پاندمی در اروپا، بسیار از کشورهای منطقه شنگن، جابجایی آزاد را محدود کرده و کنترل‌های مرزی را آغاز کردند.
en-mt: Due to this pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen area have restricted free movement and started border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: واکنش‌های ملی شامل اقداماتی برای مهار شیوع بیماری از جمله قرنطینه (که با عنوان دستور ماندن در خانه، دستور پناه گرفتن یا قرنطینه خانگی شناخته می‌شود) و حکومت نظامی می‌شد. تا 2 آوریل، در ایالات متحده حدود 300 میلیون نفر یا حدود 90% جمعیت تحت نوعی قرنطینه خانگی بودند، در فیلیپین، بیش از 50 میلیون نفر، در کره‌جنوبی حدود 59 میلیون نفر و در هند 1.3 میلیارد نفر در قرنطینه خانگی قرار گرفتند.
en-mt: National responses included measures to contain the spread of the disease, including quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or home quarantines) and martial law. As of April 2, about 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, were under some form of home quarantine in the United States, more than 50 million people in the Philippines, about 59 million people in South Korea, and 1.3 billion people in India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: در تاریخ 26 مارس، 1.7 میلیارد نفر در سراسر دنیا تحت نوعی قرنطینه قرار گرفتند که این آمار دو روز بعد به 2.6 میلیارد نفر -یعنی حدود یک سوم جمعیت دنیا- افزایش یافت.
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 billion people around the world were put under some kind of quarantine, and this number increased to 2.6 billion people two days later - that is, about a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: ردگیری اولین مورد تأیید شده کووید-19 به 1 دسامبر در ووهان برمی‌گردد؛ یک گزارش تأیید نشده می‌گوید که اولین مورد در تاریخ 17 نوامبر بوده است.
en-mt: The first confirmed case of Covid-19 was traced back to December 1 in Wuhan; An unconfirmed report says the first was on November 17.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: دکتر Zhang Jixian، در تاریخ 26 دسامبر، گروهی از افراد مبتلا به ذات‌الریه با علت نامعلوم را مشاهده کرد، که بر این اساس، این بیمارستان در تاریخ 27 دسامبر موضوع را به Wuhan Jianghan CDC اطلاع داد.
en-mt: Dr. Zhang Jixian observed a group of people with pneumonia of unknown cause on December 26, so the hospital reported the matter to the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: آزمایش اولیه ژنتیک روی نمونه‌های بیماران در 27 دسامبر 2019 نشان دهنده حضور کرونا ویروس شبه سارس بود.
en-mt: The initial genetic test on patient samples on December 27, 2019 showed the presence of Sars-like coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: در تاریخ 31 دسامبر، یک اطلاعیه عمومی توسط کمیسیون بهداشت شهر ووهان منتشر شد.
en-mt: On December 31st, a public notice was released by the Wuhan City Health Commission.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: سازمان بهداشت جهانی در همان روز از موضوع مطلع شد.
en-mt: The World Health Organization was informed on the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: با وقوع این اطلا‌ع‌رسانی‌ها، پلیس به پزشکان ووهان در مورد "پخش شایعه" در مورد شیوع بیماری هشدار داد.
en-mt: As the reports unfolded, police warned Wuhan doctors against "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: کمیسیون ملی بهداشت چین در ابتدا ادعا کرد که هیچ "شواهد روشنی" از انتقال انسان به انسان وجود ندارد.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission initially claimed there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: در اواخر ژانویه، دولت چین یک کمپین اساسی با عنوان "جنگ مردم" برای مهار گسترش این ویروس آغاز کرد که بعداً توسط Xi Jinping، دبیر کل حزب کمونیست چین شرح داده شد.
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a major "people's war" campaign to contain the spread of the virus, later described by Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Chinese Communist Party.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: در چیزی که از آن به عنوان "بزرگترین قرنطینه در تاریخ بشر" یاد می‌شود، در تاریخ 23 ژانویه یک کمربند بهداشتی مشخص شد که ورود و خروج از ووهان را متوقف کرد، این موضوع در مجموع به 15 شهر از استان هوبی گسترش یافت و در مجموع حدود 57 میلیون نفر را تحت تأثیر قرار داد.
en-mt: In what has been described as the "biggest quarantine in human history," a health belt was established on January 23 that halted entry and exit from Wuhan, spreading to a total of 15 cities in Hubei province, and in It affected a total of about 57 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: استفاده از وسیله نقلیه شخصی در شهر ممنوع بود.
en-mt: The use of private vehicles was prohibited in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: جشن‌های سال نوی چینی (25 ژانویه) در بسیاری از مکان‌ها لغو شد.
en-mt: Chinese New Year (January 25) celebrations were canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: همچنین مقامات اعلام کردند که یک بیمارستان موقت به نام بیمارستان Huoshenshan ساخته خواهد شد که ظرف مدت 10 روز تکمیل شد.
en-mt: Officials also announced that a temporary hospital called Huoshenshan Hospital would be built, which was completed within 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: پس از آن، بیمارستان دیگری به نام بیمارستان Leishenshan برای رسیدگی به بیماران بیشتر ساخته شد.
en-mt: After that, another hospital named Leishenshan Hospital was built to handle more patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: چین علاوه بر بیمارستان‌های تازه ساخته شده، 14 ساختمان دیگر در ووهان از جمله مراکز همایش و استادیوم‌ها را نیز به بیمارستان موقت تبدیل کرد. در تاریخ 26 ژانویه، دولت اقدامات دیگری را برای مهار شیوع کووید-19 آغاز کرد، از جمله اعلامیه‌های بهداشتی برای مسافران و افزایش تعطیلات جشن بهار.
en-mt: In addition to newly built hospitals, China also converted 14 other buildings in Wuhan, including convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals. On January 26, the government began other measures to contain the spread of Covid-19, including health notices for travelers and an extension of the Spring Festival holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: دانشگاه ها و مدارس نیز در سراسر کشور تعطیل شدند.
en-mt: Universities and schools were also closed across the country.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: مناطق هنگ‌کنگ و ماکائو، اقداماتی را به خصوص در زمینه مدارس و دانشگاه‌ها آغاز کردند.
en-mt: The regions of Hong Kong and Macao have started measures, especially in the field of schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: اقدامات مربوط به دورکاری در چندین منطقه از چین آغاز شد.
en-mt: Measures related to remote work began in several regions of China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: محدودیت سفر برای ورود و خروج از هوبی وضع شد.
en-mt: Travel restrictions were imposed on entry and exit from Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: حمل‌و‌نقل عمومی اصلاح شد و موزه‌ها در سراسر چین موقتاً تعطیل شدند.
en-mt: Public transportation was disrupted and museums across China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: کنترل رفت‌و‌آمد عمومی در بسیاری از شهر‌ها اعمال شد و تخمین زده می‌شود که حدود 760 میلیون نفر (بیش از نصف جمعیت) با نوعی محدودیت برای بیرون رفتن، مواجه شدند. در ماه مارس، پس از اینکه شیوع بیماری وارد مرحله جهانی شد، مقامات چین، اقدامات سختگیرانه‌ای را برای جلوگیری از "ورود" ویروس از کشورهای دیگر اتخاذ کردند.
en-mt: Curfews were imposed in many cities, and an estimated 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of restriction on going out. In March, after the outbreak went global, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: برای مثال، پکن قرنطینه 14 روزه اجباری را برای تمام مسافران بین‌المللی که وارد شهر می‌شوند، وضع کرد. در 23 مارس، در سرزمین اصلی چین تنها یک مورد طی پنج روز قبل از آن به داخل کشور منتقل شد، که این مورد توسط مسافری که از استانبول به گوانگژو برمی‌گشت، اتفاق افتاد.
en-mt: For example, Beijing imposed a mandatory 14-day quarantine on all international travelers entering the city. As of March 23, mainland China had only one case of domestic transmission in the previous five days, that of a traveler returning from Istanbul to Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: در 24 مارس 2020، نخست وزیر چین Li Keqiang گزارش داد که جلوی انتقال بیماری در داخل کشور به طور اساسی گرفته شده و شیوع بیماری در چین کنترل شده است.
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the domestic transmission of the disease has been substantially stopped and the outbreak in China has been controlled.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: در همان روز، یعنی دو ماه پس از وضع قرنطینه، محدودیت‌های سفر در هوبی کاهش پیدا کرد، به جز شهر ووهان. وزارت امور خارجه چین در 26 مارس 2020 اعلام کرد که ورود به کشور برای دارندگان ویزا یا مجوز اقامت از 28 مارس به بعد تعلیق خواهد شد و هیچ جزئیاتی در مورد اینکه چه زمانی اجرای این سیاست پایان خواهد یافت، ارائه نکرد.
en-mt: On the same day, two months into the quarantine, travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, except for the city of Wuhan. China's Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on March 26, 2020 that entry into the country for holders of visas or residence permits would be suspended from March 28, and did not provide any details on when the policy would end.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: کسانی که می‌خواهند به چین وارد شوند، مجبور خواهند بودند در سفارتخانه‌ها یا کنسولگری‌های چین درخواست ویزا دهند.
en-mt: Those who want to enter China will have to apply for a visa at Chinese embassies or consulates.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: دولت چین در 30 مارس، کسب‌و‌کارها و کارخانه‌ها را ترغیب به بازگشایی کرد و بسته‌های محرک پولی برای شرکت‌ها ارائه کرد. شورای دولتی اعلام کرد که روز 4 آوریل که مصادف با روز زیارت اهل قبور است، عزای عمومی خواهد بود و با سه دقیقه سکوت در سطح کشور در ساعت 10:00 آغاز خواهد شد، با این حال، دولت مرکزی از خانواده‌ها درخواست کرد که برای رعایت فاصله‌گذاری فیزیکی و به منظور جلوگیری از شیوع مجدد کووید-19، به صورت آنلاین به رفتگان ادای احترام کنند.
en-mt: On March 30, the Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to reopen, offering monetary stimulus packages for companies. The State Council announced that April 4, which coincides with the Day of Pilgrimage to the Graves, will be a day of public mourning and will begin with three minutes of silence nationwide at 10:00 a.m. However, the central government requested families to Observing physical distance and in order to prevent the spread of covid-19, pay tribute to the departed online.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: در 20 ژانویه 2020 تأیید شد که کووید-19 از طریق چین به کره‌جنوبی منتقل شده است.
en-mt: On January 20, 2020, it was confirmed that Covid-19 had been transmitted to South Korea via China.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: اداره بهداشت این کشور در 20 فوریه، از افزایش قابل توجه موارد تأیید شده خبر داد که عمدتاً به یک گردهمایی در Daegu مربوط می‌شد که به یک جنبش مذهبی جدید با نام کلیسای مسیح تعلق داشت.
en-mt: On February 20, the country's health department reported a significant increase in confirmed cases, mostly linked to a gathering in Daegu belonging to a new religious movement called the Church of Christ.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: اینگونه گمان می‌شد که مریدان Shincheonji که از ووهان به Daegu آمده بودند، منشأ این شیوع بودند.
en-mt: Shincheonji disciples who came to Daegu from Wuhan were thought to be the source of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: تا 22 فوریه، از 9336 پیرو این کلیسا، وجود علایم در 1261 نفر یعنی حدود 13% از آنها گزارش شده بود. کره‌جنوبی در 23 فوریه بالاترین سطح هشدار را اعلام کرد.
en-mt: As of February 22, out of 9,336 followers of this church, the presence of symptoms was reported in 1,261 people, about 13% of them. South Korea announced the highest alert level on February 23.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: در 28 فوریه، بیش از 2000 مورد تأیید شده در کره گزارش شد که این تعداد در 29 فوریه، به 3150 مورد افزایش یافت.
en-mt: On February 28, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, which increased to 3,150 on February 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: پس از مثبت اعلام شدن آزمایش سه سرباز، تمام پایگاه‌های نظامی کره‌جنوبی قرنطینه شدند.
en-mt: After the three soldiers tested positive, all South Korean military bases were quarantined.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: برنامه خطوط هوایی نیز تحت تأثیر قرار گرفت و در نتیجه تغییر کرد. کره‌جنوبی برنامه‌ای را برای غربالگری جمعیت و ایزوله کردن افراد معرفی کرد که بزرگترین و سازمان‌یافته‌ترین برنامه در سطح دنیا برای غربالگری جمعیت و ایزوله کردن تمام افراد آلوده و همچنین ردگیری و قرنطینه کردن افرادی که با آنها در ارتباط بوده‌اند، شناخته می‌شد.
en-mt: The airline schedule was also affected and changed as a result. South Korea introduced a program to screen the population and isolate people, which was known as the largest and most organized program in the world to screen the population and isolate all infected people, as well as trace and quarantine people who have been in contact with them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: روش‌های غربالگری شامل گزارش‌دهی اجباری علایم توسط خود شخص برای مسافران بین‌المللی تازه وارد از طریق برنامه تلفن همراه، مراکز آزمایشی که با خودرو می‌توان وارد شد و نتایج در روز بعد مشخص می‌شود و افزایش ظرفیت آزمایش به 20,000 نفر در روز می‌شود.
en-mt: Screening methods include mandatory self-reporting of symptoms for newly arriving international travelers via a mobile app, drive-in testing centers with next-day results, and an increase in testing capacity to 20,000 people per day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: برنامه کره‌جنوبی، علیرغم قرنطینه نکردن کل شهرها، یکی از برنامه‌های موفق در کنترل شیوع بیماری تلقی می‌شود. جامعه کره‌جنوبی در ابتدا نسبت به واکنش رئیس جمهور Moon Jae-in به این بحران، دوقطبی شد.
en-mt: South Korea's program, despite not quarantining entire cities, is considered one of the successful programs in controlling the spread of the disease. South Korean society was initially polarized over President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: بسیاری از مردم کره، دادخواست‌هایی را برای استیضاح Moon برای آنچه آنها بد اداره کردن دولت می‌نامیدند امضا کردند و برخی دیگر واکنش او را تحسین می‌کردند.
en-mt: Many Koreans signed petitions calling for Moon's impeachment for what they called mishandling the government, and others applauded his response.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: در 23 مارس، گزارش شد که کره‌جنوبی کمترین آمار ابتلای یک روزه را در چهار هفته اخیر دارد.
en-mt: On March 23, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest number of single-day infections in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: در 29 مارس گزارش شد که از 1 آوریل، تمام مسافرانی که از خارج، به کشور وارد می‌شوند به مدت دو هفته قرنطینه خواهند شد.
en-mt: On March 29, it was reported that starting April 1, all travelers entering the country from abroad will be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: بر اساس گزارش رسانه‌ها در 1 آوریل، کره‌جنوبی درخواست‌هایی را برای کمک در زمینه آزمایش ویروس از طرف 121 کشور مختلف دریافت کرد.
en-mt: According to media reports on April 1, South Korea received requests for help with virus testing from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: ایران، اولین مورد تأییدشده از آلودگی به SARS-CoV-2 را در 19 فوریه در قم گزارش داد، شهری که بر اساس سخنان وزیر بهداشت و آموزش پزشکی، بعداً دو نفر در همان روز فوت کردند.
en-mt: Iran reported its first confirmed case of SARS-CoV-2 infection on February 19 in Qom, a city where two people died later that day, according to the Minister of Health and Medical Education.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: اقدامات اولیه که توسط دولت اعلام شد شامل لغو کنسرت‌ها و سایر رویدادهای فرهنگی، ورزشی، نماز جمعه‌ها و تعطیلی دانشگاه‌ها، مؤسسات آموزش عالی و مدارس می‌شد.
en-mt: Initial measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural and sporting events, Friday prayers and the closure of universities, higher education institutions and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: ایران پنج تریلیون ریال را به مبارزه با این ویروس اختصاص داد.
en-mt: Iran allocated five trillion rials to fight this virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: رئیس جمهور حسن روحانی در 26 فوریه 2020 گفت که هیچ طرحی برای قرنطینه نواحی متأثر از شیوع این بیماری وجود ندارد و تنها افراد قرنطینه خواهند شد.
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on February 26, 2020 that there is no plan to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak of this disease and only people will be quarantined.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: در ماه مارس، طرح‌هایی برای محدود کردن سفر بین شهرها اعلام شد، با این وجود ترافیک سنگین بین شهرها در آستانه جشن سال نوی ایرانی نوروز ادامه داشت.
en-mt: In March, plans were announced to limit travel between the cities, however heavy traffic between the cities continued ahead of the Iranian New Year celebration of Nowruz.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: حرم‌های شیعه در قم تا 16 مارس 2020، به روی زائران باز ماندند.در فوریه، ایران به مرکز شیوع این ویروس پس از چین تبدیل شد.
en-mt: Shiite shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until March 16, 2020. In February, Iran became the center of the virus outbreak after China.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: در میان ادعاهای مبنی بر پنهان کردن میزان واقعی شیوع بیماری در ایران، تا 28 فوریه ردگیری موارد ابتلا در بیش از ده کشور نشان داد که منشأ ابتلای آنها به ایران برمی‌گردد، که این موضوع نشان می‌داد میزان واقعی شیوع بیماری، احتمالاً بیش از 388 موردی است که دولت ایران تا آن تاریخ گزارش داده بود.
en-mt: Amid allegations of concealment of the true extent of the disease outbreak in Iran, as of February 28, tracing of cases in more than a dozen countries showed that their source of infection was Iran, suggesting that the true extent of the disease outbreak may be more than 388 cases. that the government of Iran had reported until that date.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: با مثبت اعلام شدن آزمایش 23 نفر از 290 نماینده مجلس در 3 مارس، مجلس ایران تعطیل شد.
en-mt: As 23 out of 290 MPs tested positive on March 3, Iran's parliament was closed.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: در 12 مارس، دیده‌بان حقوق بشر از مسئولان اداره زندان‌های ایران درخواست کرد تا بدون هیچ قید و شرطی، مدافعان حقوق بشر را که به دلیل مخالفت صلح‌آمیز بازداشت شده بودند و همچنین تمام زندانیان واجد شرایط را به طور موقت آزاد کنند.
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch called on Iran's prison authorities to unconditionally release human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, as well as temporarily release all eligible prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: این دیده‌بان اعلام کرد که خطر شیوع ویروس در محل‌های بسته مانند مراکز بازداشت که فاقد مراقبت‌های پزشکی کافی نیز هستند، بیشتر است.
en-mt: The watchdog said that the risk of the virus spreading is higher in closed places such as detention centers, which also lack adequate medical care.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: در 15 مارس، دولت ایران 100 مورد مرگ را تنها در یک روز گزارش داد که بالاترین آمار در این کشور از زمان آغاز شیوع بیماری بود.
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in just one day, the highest number in the country since the outbreak began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: تا 17 مارس، حداقل 12 سیاستمدار یا مقام دولتی فعلی یا سابق ایران بر اثر این بیماری جان باختند.
en-mt: As of March 17, at least 12 current or former Iranian politicians or government officials have died from the disease.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: تا 23 مارس، ایران در هر ساعت 50 مورد ابتلای جدید و هر ده دقیقه، یک مورد مرگ جدید را به علت کرونا ویروس تجربه می‌کرد.
en-mt: Until March 23, Iran was experiencing 50 new infections every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to the coronavirus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: بر اساس سخنان یکی از مقامات سازمان بهداشت جهانی، احتمال دارد موارد ابتلا در ایران، پنج برابر آماری باشد که گزارش می‌شود.
en-mt: According to the words of an official of the World Health Organization, it is possible that the cases of infection in Iran are five times the statistics that are reported.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: همچنین اینگونه تصور می‌شود که تحریم‌های ایالات متحده علیه ایران، ممکن است بر توانایی مالی این کشور برای مقابله با شیوع این بیماری ویروسی تأثیر منفی گذاشته باشد.
en-mt: It is also thought that the US sanctions against Iran may have negatively affected the country's financial ability to deal with the spread of this viral disease.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: کمیساریای عالی حقوق بشر سازمان ملل درخواست کرده است که تحریم‌های اقتصادی برای کشورهایی که بیشترین تأثیر را از این پاندمی پذیرفته‌اند، از جمله ایران کاهش یابد.
en-mt: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights has requested that economic sanctions be eased for the countries most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: در 31 ژانویه، زمانی که نتیجه آزمایش دو گردشگر چینی در رم برای ابتلا به SARS-CoV-2 مثبت اعلام شد، شیوع این بیماری در ایتالیا تأیید شد.
en-mt: An outbreak of the disease was confirmed in Italy on January 31, when two Chinese tourists in Rome tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: تعداد موارد ابتلا شروع به افزایش شدید کرد که موجب شد دولت ایتالیا تمام پروازهای با مبدأ یا مقصد چین را تعلیق کند و حالت اضطراری اعلام کند.
en-mt: The number of cases began to rise sharply, prompting the Italian government to suspend all flights to or from China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: بعدها گروهی از موارد نامرتبط ابتلا به کووید-19 شناسایی شد که با 16 مورد تأیید شده در Lombardy در 21 فوریه آغاز شد. در 22 فوریه، هیئت وزیران یک حکم قانونی جدید برای مهار شیوع این بیماری اعلام کرد که شامل قرنطینه بیش از 50,000 نفر از 11 شهر مختلف در شمال ایتالیا می‌شد.
en-mt: A cluster of unrelated cases of Covid-19 was later identified, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on February 21. On February 22, the cabinet announced a new legal order to contain the outbreak, which included the quarantine of more than 50,000 people from 11 different cities in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: نخست وزیر جوزپه کونته گفت: "در مناطقی که بیماری در آنها شایع است، ورود و خروج امکانپذیر نخواهد بود.
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said: "In areas where the disease is common, entry and exit will not be possible.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: دستور تعلیق فعالیت‌های کاری و رویدادهای ورزشی نیز در این مناطق صادر شده است."در تاریخ 4 مارس و با رسیدن تعداد کشته شده ها به 100 نفر، دولت ایتالیا دستور داد که تمام مدارس و دانشگاه ها در سراسر کشور بصورت کامل تعطیل شوند.
en-mt: The suspension of work activities and sports events has also been issued in these areas. On March 4th, with the death toll reaching 100, the Italian government ordered the complete closure of all schools and universities across the country.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: تمام رویدادهای ورزشی اصلی از جمله مسابقات فوتبال سری A، تا ماه آوریل باید پشت درهای بسته انجام می‌شد اما در 9 مارس، تمام رویدادهای ورزشی به طور کامل حداقل به مدت یک ماه تعلیق شد.
en-mt: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be played behind closed doors until April, but on March 9, all sporting events were suspended entirely for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: در 11 مارس، نخست وزیر کونته دستور توقف تقریباً تمام فعالیت‌های تجاری به جز سوپرمارکت‌ها و داروخانه‌ها را صادر کرد. در 6 مارس دانشکده بیهوشی، بی‌حسی، احیا و مراقبت‌های ویژه ایتالیا (SIAARTI) توصیه‌هایی را در زمینه اخلاق پزشکی در مورد پروتکل‌های تریاژ که ممکن است استفاده شود، منتشر کرد.
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Conte ordered the shutdown of almost all commercial activities except for supermarkets and pharmacies. On March 6, the Italian Academy of Anaesthesiology, Anesthesia, Resuscitation and Critical Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations on the triage protocols that may be used.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: در 19 مارس، پس از گزارش 3,405 مورد مرگ به دلیل این پاندمی، ایتالیا به عنوان کشور دارای بیشترین تعداد مرگ‌و‌میر مرتبط با کرونا ویروس در دنیا، از چین سبقت گرفت.
en-mt: On March 19, Italy overtook China as the country with the highest number of coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 deaths from the pandemic.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: در 22 مارس، گزارش شد که روسیه نه هواپیمای نظامی حاوی تجهیزات پزشکی را به ایتالیا ارسال کرده است.
en-mt: On March 22, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes containing medical equipment to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: تا 5 آوریل، 128,948 مورد تأیید شده، 15,887 کشته و 21,815 بهبود یافته در ایتالیا وجود داشت و اغلب این موارد در Lombardy بودند.
en-mt: As of April 5, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, most of them in Lombardy.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: گزارشی از CNN نشان داد که ترکیب دو عامل جمعیت زیاد افراد مسن و عدم توانایی برای آزمایش تمام افرادی که تا به امروز به ویروس مبتلا هستند، می‌تواند در نرخ بالای مرگ‌و‌میر مؤثر باشد.
en-mt: A CNN report suggested that the combination of a large population of elderly people and the inability to test everyone who has the virus to date could contribute to the high death rate.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: واکنش انگلیس به این ویروس، یکی از ساده‌ترین واکنش‌ها در میان کشورهای متأثر از این بیماری بود و تا 18 مارس 2020، دولت انگلیس هیچ گونه فاصله‌گذاری اجتماعی یا اقدامات قرنطینه انبوه را برای شهروندانش وضع نکرد.
en-mt: The UK's response to the virus was one of the most light-hearted among countries affected by the disease, and as of 18 March 2020, the UK government had not imposed any social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
